intro: Reynoldsia marchionensis, commonly known as the Marchioness reynoldsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
